inference: Final Answer: $\boxed{30\pi}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: The cylinder and cone both have radius $\sqrt{3}$ and height 10.  The cylinder has volume $\pi (\sqrt{3})^2 (10)=30\pi$ and the cone has volume $(1/3) \pi (\sqrt{3})^2 (10)=10\pi$; the sum of these volumes is $\boxed{40\pi}$.
